Name.description: The name, as passed to the --distribution argument.

FolderName.description: The relative path that the .uproject file is located underneath.

ProjectName.description: The name of the .uproject file underneath the folder, without the .uproject extension.

Prepare.description: Specifies the preparation scripts to run before various steps. You can specify multiple preparation entries.

RunBefore.description: The types of steps that the preparation script should run before. A set of "AssembleFinalize", "Compile", "Test" and "BuildGraph".

items.description: The types of steps that the preparation script should run before. A set of "AssembleFinalize", "Compile", "Test" and "BuildGraph".

ScriptPath.description: The path to the PowerShell script to execute, relative to the repository root.

Targets.description: A list of targets to build.

items.description: A list of targets to build.

Platforms.description: A list of platforms to build the project for.

items.description: A list of platforms to build the project for.
If not specified, defaults to ["Development", "Shipping"].

Targets.description: A list of targets to build.

items.description: A list of targets to build.

Platforms.description: A list of platforms to build the project for.

items.description: A list of platforms to build the project for.
If not specified, defaults to ["Development", "Shipping"].

Targets.description: A list of targets to build.

items.description: A list of targets to build.

Platforms.description: A list of platforms to build the project for.

items.description: A list of platforms to build the project for.
If not specified, defaults to ["Development", "Shipping"].

Tests.description: A list of tests to run for the project.

ScriptPath.description:
The path to the test script, relative to the repository root.
The script receives the following parameters:
  -EnginePath "C:\Path\To\UnrealEngine"
  -StageDirectory "C:\Path\To\UProject\Saved\StagedBuilds"

Requires.description: Specifies the configurations and platforms that the Gauntlet tests is dependent on.

Type.description: Specifies the dependency type (Game, Client or Server).

items.description: The platforms to depend on.

ScriptPath.description: The relative path to the Gauntlet script to execute.

DeviceListPath.description: The relative path to the device list to use.

TestName.description: The name of the test to run inside the Gauntlet script.

Deployments.description: A list of deployments to run for the project.

ScriptPath.description:
The path to the custom deployment script.
The script receives the following parameters:
  -EnginePath "C:\Path\To\UnrealEngine"
  -StageDirectory "C:\Path\To\UProject\Saved\StagedBuilds"
  -PackageDirectory "C:\Path\To\UProject\Saved\StagedBuilds\LinuxServer"
  -PackageType "Game"
  -PackageTarget "ExampleOSS"
  -PackagePlatform "Win64"
  -PackageConfiguration "DebugGame"

AppID.description: The Steam app ID to deploy to.

DepotID.description: The Steam depot ID to deploy to.

Channel.description: The Steam channel to deploy to.

PluginName.description: The name of your plugin. It must be such that "PluginName/PluginName.uplugin" exists.

Header.description: Used for Marketplace submissions and update-copyright command.

ExcludePaths.description: If set, these files will not have their headers updated during packaging.

items.description: If set, these files will not have their headers updated during packaging.

Name.description: The name, as passed to the --distribution argument.

EnvironmentVariables.description: A list of environment variables to set during the build.

additionalProperties.description: A list of environment variables to set during the build.

Filespecs.description: A list of filespecs that should be cleaned. Use * as a wildcard for a single path component, or ... as a wildcard for multiple path components.

items.description: A list of filespecs that should be cleaned. Use * as a wildcard for a single path component, or ... as a wildcard for multiple path components.

Prepare.description: Specifies the preparation scripts to run before various steps. You can specify multiple preparation entries.

RunBefore.description: The types of steps that the preparation script should run before. A set of "AssembleFinalize", "Compile", "Test" and "BuildGraph".

items.description: The types of steps that the preparation script should run before. A set of "AssembleFinalize", "Compile", "Test" and "BuildGraph".

ScriptPath.description: The path to the PowerShell script to execute, relative to the repository root.

Platforms.description: A list of platforms to build the plugin for on the editor target.

items.description: A list of platforms to build the plugin for on the editor target.

Platforms.description: A list of platforms to build the plugin for on the target.

items.description: A list of platforms to build the plugin for on the target.
If not specified, defaults to ["Development", "Shipping"].

Platforms.description: A list of platforms to build the plugin for on the target.

items.description: A list of platforms to build the plugin for on the target.
If not specified, defaults to ["Development", "Shipping"].

Platforms.description: A list of platforms to build the plugin for on the target.

items.description: A list of platforms to build the plugin for on the target.
If not specified, defaults to ["Development", "Shipping"].

Tests.description: A list of tests to run for the plugin.

TestPrefix.description: Only tests with this prefix will be executed for automation testing.

Platforms.description: A list of platforms to execute automation tests on. A set of "Win64", "Mac" or both.

items.description: A list of platforms to execute automation tests on. A set of "Win64", "Mac" or both.

ConfigFiles.description: A list of folders whose contents should be copied into the Config folder of the host project used for automation testing. This is used to set configuration if your automation tests require specific configuration values to be set.

items.description: A list of folders whose contents should be copied into the Config folder of the host project used for automation testing. This is used to set configuration if your automation tests require specific configuration values to be set.

MinWorkerCount.description: The minimum number of processes to launch for automation testing on the machine, regardless of available RAM. If not set, defaults to 1.

TestRunTimeoutMinutes.description: The timeout in minutes for running the whole automation test suite. If not set, defaults to 5 minutes.

TestTimeoutMinutes.description: The timeout in minutes for running an individual test. If not set, no timeout applies.

TestAttemptCount.description: The maximum number of times a test should be attempted if it fails. If not set, tests are never retried on failure.

Name.description: The name of the commandlet to run.

AdditionalArguments.description: Additional command line arguments to pass to Unreal Editor when running the commandlet.

items.description: Additional command line arguments to pass to Unreal Editor when running the commandlet.

Platforms.description: A list of platforms to execute this commandlet test on. A set of "Win64", "Mac" or both.

items.description: A list of platforms to execute this commandlet test on. A set of "Win64", "Mac" or both.

LogStartSignal.description:
To detect scenarios where the Unreal Editor stalls between startup and the commandlet
running, you can make your commandlet emit a log when it starts and then set that log
line here. If the editor doesn't start executing the commandlet code before LogStartTimeoutMinutes
d,

LogStartTimeoutMinutes.description:
If set, the editor must emit LogStartSignal
number of minutes elapses. If it doesn't, the editor instance is killed and the commandlet test is attempted
again, up to TestAttemptCount

PreStartScriptPath.description:
The path to a PowerShell script to run before the commandlet starts. This can be used
to prepare the environment for the commandlet to run in, such as terminating processes
or writing data to the filesystem.

The pre-start script is passed the following parameters:
  -EnginePath "C:\Path\To\UnrealEngine"
  -TestProjectPath "C:\Path\To\UProject\File.uproject"

ValidationScriptPath.description:
The path to a PowerShell script which can be used to validate that the commandlet
performed the intended behaviour. This script is only run if the editor exits with
a non-zero exit code, and should be used to validate some global state of the
system (such that the commandlet ran a process, or modified files on the filesystem).

The validation script is passed the following parameters:
  -EnginePath "C:\Path\To\UnrealEngine"
  -TestProjectPath "C:\Path\To\UProject\File.uproject"

TestAttemptCount.description: The maximum number of times this commandlet test should be attempted if it fails. If not set, the commandlet is never automatically retried.

GlobalMutexName.description:
If set, this global mutex is obtained for the duration of the test. This includes the
pre-start and validation scripts. This can be used to ensure that a commandlet that
impacts the global environment (like running a process) will not be run concurrently
across different build jobs on the same machine.

TestAgainst.description: Must be set to either "TestProject" or "PackagedPlugin".

Platforms.description: A list of platforms to execute custom tests on. A set of "Win64", "Mac" or both.

items.description: A list of platforms to execute custom tests on. A set of "Win64", "Mac" or both.

ScriptPath.description:
The path to the test script, relative to the repository root.
If you are testing against "TestProject", then the script receives the following parameters:
  -EnginePath "C:\Path\To\UnrealEngine"
  -TestProjectPath "C:\Path\To\UProject\File.uproject"
If you are testing against "PackagedPlugin", then the script receives the following parameters:
  -EnginePath "C:\Path\To\UnrealEngine"
  -TempPath "C:\Path\To\TemporaryFolder"
  -PackagedPluginPath "C:\Path\To\PackagedPlugin"

Requires.description: Specifies the configurations and platforms that the Gauntlet tests is dependent on.

Type.description: Specifies the dependency type (Game, Client or Server).

items.description: The platforms to depend on.

ScriptPath.description: The relative path to the Gauntlet script to execute.

DeviceListPath.description: The relative path to the device list to use.

TestName.description: The name of the test to run inside the Gauntlet script.

Marketplace.description: If true, the plugin is packaged for Marketplace submission. If not set, defaults to false.

Filter.description: The path to the FilterPlugin.ini file used for packaging.

BucketName.description: The Backblaze B2 bucket to upload to.

FolderPrefixEnvVar.description: The environment variable that contains the folder prefix to use when uploading. This should be set on your build server and made available to build jobs.

ConfigFiles.description: Configuration files to apply to the project that hosts Gauntlet tests.

items.description: Configuration files to apply to the project that hosts Gauntlet tests.
